tag.name: cfreport
tag.help: Used to do either of the following: - Execute a report definition created with the ColdFusion Report Builder, displaying it in PDF, FlashPaper, or Excel format. You can optionally save this report to a file. - Run a predefined Crystal Reports report. Applies only to Windows systems. Uses the CFCRYSTAL.exe file to generate reports. Sets parameters in the Crystal Reports engine according to its attribute values.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: Specifies the path to the report definition file, relative to the web root.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the ColdFusion variable that will hold the report output. You cannot specify both name and filename.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.help: The filename to contain the report. You cannot specify both name and filename.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: The name of the query that contains input data for the report. If you omit this parameter, the report definition obtains data from the internal SQL or from cfreportparam items.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Specifies whether to overwrite files that have the same name as that specified in the filename attribute. Default: false

parameter.name: encryption
parameter.help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted. PDF format only. Default: none

parameter.name: ownerpassword
parameter.help: Specifies an owner password. PDF format only.

parameter.name: userpassword
parameter.help: Specifies a user password. PDF format only.

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.help: Specifies one or more permissions. PDF format only. Separate multiple permissions with a comma.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of registered or native data source.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * standard (not valid for Crystal Reports 8.0) * netscape * microsoft

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum time, in seconds, in which a connection must be made to a Crystal Report.

parameter.name: report
parameter.help: Report path. Store Crystal Reports files in the same directories as CFML page files.

parameter.name: orderby
parameter.help: Orders results according to your specifications.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Username required for entry into database from which report is created. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password that corresponds to username required for database access. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.

parameter.name: formula
parameter.help:
One or more named formulas. Terminate each formula with a semicolon. Use the format:
formula = "formulaname1='formula1';formulaname2='formula2';"
If you use a semicolon in a formula, you must escape it by typing it twice (;;). For example:
formula = "Name1 = 'Val_1a;;Val_1b';Name2 = 'Val2';"
